title: iMac 27" Late 2013 820-3481
message:
Got an iMac that thunderbolt is not working. Opened up iMac and discovered a noticeable burn in the thunderbolt IC U2800. The part number is DSL3510L and I have this same IC on a donor 820-3437 MBA L2013. My question is, is it even possible to replace the Thunderbolt IC, or is the firmware paired to the CPU somehow since it uses PCIe lane.

I have attached an image of the burn in the thunderbolt IC.

title: iMac 27" Late 2013 820-3481
message: Just try, I don't think to be paired.

title: iMac 27" Late 2013 820-3481
message: Excellent. Replacing the Thunderbolt IC resolved the issue. This one is solved.

title: iMac 27" Late 2013 820-3481
message:
Thanks for feedback.
Is good to have a confirmation, that chip doesn't have a specific board firmware.

title: iMac 27" Late 2013 820-3481
message: I had the same problem, same solution, I can confirm that it works (I toke also from 820-3437), the burning point was in the same place! Great job [USER=2552]@EsteTron[/USER], thanks for that post!

title: iMac 27" Late 2013 820-3481
message: Awesome! I am happy to hear that this worked for you as well!
